nodes.name: Create Cluster
nodes.description: This node creates a new Cluster in Databricks by using details in configuration and passes the cluster ID to the next step.
nodes.details:
Create Databricks Cluster


This node creates a new Cluster in Databricks by using details in configuration and passes the cluster ID to the next step.

fields.title: Task Name
fields.description: Unique name of the task in airflow DAG.

fields.name: DriverTypeId
fields.title: Driver Type

fields.name: NodeTypeId
fields.title: Worker Type

fields.name: MaxWorkers
fields.title: Number of maximum Workers
fields.description: Number of maximum Workers. Value can be empty, when auto scale is not required.

fields.name: AutoTermination
fields.title: Auto Termination (minutes)
fields.description: Automatically terminates the cluster after it is inactive for this time in minutes.If not set, this cluster will not be automatically terminated. If specified, the threshold must be between 10 and 10000 minutes.

fields.name: DataSecurityMode
fields.title: Data Security Mode
fields.description: Different data security modes such as NONE,USER_ISOLATION,LEGACY_TABLE_ACL,LEGACY_SINGLE_USER. For more modes refer Link: https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/clusters/create#data_security_mode

nodes.name: Run Notebook
nodes.description: This node use to submit a new Databricks job to Cluster by using details in configuration
nodes.details:
Submit Spark Job to Cluster


This node use to submit a new Databricks job to Cluster by using details in configuration.
nodes.examples:
Submit Spark Job to Cluster Examples


new_cluster = {
"spark_version": "9.1.x-scala2.12",
"node_type_id": "r3.xlarge",
"aws_attributes": {"availability": "ON_DEMAND"},
"num_workers": 8,
}

notebook_task_params = {
"new_cluster": new_cluster,
"notebook_task": {
"notebook_path": "/Users/airflow@example.com/PrepareData",
},
}

notebook_task = DatabricksSubmitRunOperator(task_id="notebook_task", json=notebook_task_params)

fields.name: Name
fields.title: Task Name
fields.description: Unique name of the task in airflow DAG.

fields.name: ClusterId
fields.title: Cluster Id
fields.description: If Cluster ID is empty, the step tries to pick the cluster ID from previous create cluster node(task).

fields.name: timeout
fields.title: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout for your Databricks task in Airflow to give it more time to complete, especially if it's waiting for the cluster to reach the RUNNING state(In seconds).
